intro: Anthyllis vulneraria proles gandogeri, commonly known as the Gandogeri broom, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing a preference for well-drained soils. It has a low-growing habit with compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
